alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 3:32PM PST until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Salinas River near Bradley affecting Monterey County. For the SALINAS RIVER...including Bradley...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Salinas River near Bradley. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM PST Friday the stage was 11.54 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening and crest around 17.3 feet tonight. The river is forecast to fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 330 AM PST.
